intro: Combretum imberbe var. truncatum, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, clustered red flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. Its unique appearance and adaptability contribute to its widespread cultivation.
